Package net.sf.debianmaven

Class FixPermission

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.debianmaven.FixPermission
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class FixPermission
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Parameter container for fixing permissions.
    Author:
    FracPete (fracpete at waikato dot ac dot nz)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      boolean appliesTo​(File file)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FixPermission

        public FixPermission()
        Default constructor.

      • FixPermission

        public FixPermission​(String include,
                     String permissions)
              throws PatternSyntaxException,
                     IllegalArgumentException
        Uses the provided include, permissions.
        Parameters:
        include - the include pattern
        permissions - the POSIX permissions
        Throws:
        PatternSyntaxException - if include pattern is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if permissions are invalid
        See Also:
        setInclude(String), setPermissions(String)

    • Method Detail

      • setInclude

        public void setInclude​(String value)
                throws PatternSyntaxException
        Sets the include regular expression.
        Parameters:
        value - the expression
        Throws:
        PatternSyntaxException - if the string is not a value regular expression

        public String getInclude()
        Returns the include regular expression.
        Returns:
        the expression, null if none set

        the pattern, null if none compiled

      • setPermissions

        public void setPermissions​(String value)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the POSIX permissions string (eg 'rwxr-xr-x').
        Parameters:
        value - the permissions
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if permissions invalid

      • getPermissions

        public String getPermissions()
        Returns the POSIX permissions string.
        Returns:
        the permissions, null if none set

        Returns:
        the permissions, null if none set

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks whether the setup is valid.
        Returns:
        true if include pattern and permissions set present

      • appliesTo

        public boolean appliesTo​(File file)
        Checks whether the file is handled by this setup.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to check
        Returns:
        true if handled
        See Also:
        isValid()

      • applyTo

        public boolean applyTo​(File file)
                throws IOException
        Applies the POSIX permissions to the file (if the include pattern triggers).
        Parameters:
        file - the file to update
        Returns:
        true if permissions updated
        Throws:
        IOException - if applying of permissions failed

        Returns a short description of the setup.
